message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

The paper focuses on learning continuous Signed Distance Function (SDF) on shapes, which is a common task in computer graphics and computer vision. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also discusses the use of a curriculum to organize the learning task, which is related to machine learning and education. This suggests that the paper could also be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper deals with 3D shape representation learning, which is relevant to computer graphics and geometry processing, indicating that it could be classified under cs.GR (Computer Graphics) as well. Finally, the paper uses a neural network to learn the SDF, which is a common technique in deep learning, suggesting that it could also be categorized under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
